meanings.definition: The practice of maintaining strict control over all aspects of a society or group.
meanings.sent1: The totalism of the strict leader made everyone follow the same rules.
meanings.sent2: Totalism in a community can sometimes lead to limited personal freedom.
meanings.sent3: The totalism of the school principal's new dress code caused quite a stir among the students.
meanings.sent4: The totalism of the company's policies suffocated creativity among the employees.
meanings.sent5: Living under the totalism of constant surveillance felt like being trapped in a cage.

meanings.definition: A system of government that seeks to control all aspects of public and private life.
meanings.sent1: The citizens rebelled against the totalism of the oppressive regime.
meanings.sent2: Totalism can sometimes lead to a lack of individual rights in a society.
meanings.sent3: The totalism of the new law banning all outdoor activities seemed extreme to many.
meanings.sent4: The totalism of the government's censorship stifled freedom of expression.
meanings.sent5: The totalism of the surveillance state invaded every aspect of citizens' lives.

meanings.definition: The belief in or advocacy of a total or complete system or organization.
meanings.sent1: His totalism in creating a perfect plan left no room for error.
meanings.sent2: Totalism in business management can sometimes overlook individual needs.
meanings.sent3: The totalism of the team leader's strict schedule made everyone nervous.
meanings.sent4: The totalism of the new software aimed to streamline all processes efficiently.
meanings.sent5: Embracing totalism in design can lead to a cohesive and unified product.
